intro: Aciphylla, commonly known as the silver tussock grass, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. These plants are native to the southern hemisphere, particularly found in Australia, New Zealand, and South America. Aciphylla species are characterized by their dense, woolly foliage that gives them a silvery appearance. They typically grow in arid or semi-arid environments, thriving in well-drained soils. Many species are used in horticulture for their ornamental value and drought tolerance.
